intro: Randia killipii, commonly known as Killip's randia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its opposite, simple leaves and small, clustered white or pink flowers. It typically grows in moist, well-drained soils in woodland or swampy areas. Randia killipii is often found in the understory of forests, where it thrives in partial shade.
